author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police have arrested three persons involved in lending money at exorbitant rate of interest.

The arrested were: Shaeeda Banu, Shajahan and Saravanan.

While Shaeeda Banu and Shajahan were moneylenders, Saravanan was charged with threatening a borrower. Jeeva, who accompanied Saravanan is yet to be arrested.

The complaint was lodged by Malarvizhi, wife of Jeyakumar of Suramangalam who was working in Nigeria. She had borrowed Rs. 50,000 after pledging documents.

She was given Rs. 30,000 after deducting Rs. 20,000 as interest.

She said that she paid the money in full but Shaeeda Banu and Shajahan refused to return the documents.

Instead they demanded that she pay another Rs. 2 lakh.

They sent Jeeva, and Saravanan to her house to threaten her.

A case has been registered under Sections 447 (criminal trespass), 294 (b) (uttering obscene words in public place), 506 (i) (criminal intimidation of IPC r/w Tamil Nadu Prohibition of Charging Exorbitant Interest Act, 2003.

Youth held

The Forest Department personnel arrested two youth on the charge of attempting to hunt wild hare at Kattilkuthikaradu reserve forests, near Omalur, on Tuesday.

On a tip off, a special party led by Pandurangan, Danishpettai Range Officer, conducted surprise checks in the reserve forests, and found these two moving around in a suspicious manner.

The arrested were Ravi (23) of Guruvareddiyur in Gundukkal panchayat, and Palanisamy (30) of Manjal Alli village in Pennagaram taluk of Dharmapuri district.

A fine of Rs. 25,000 each was slapped on them.
title: Usury: three, including woman, arrested
